text:
Dear Tomcat developers,

by today i tried to use the Spring Security 3.0 Package in a Spring 3.0.5 Web Application with a Tomcat 7.0.19 on Java version 1.6.0_25.

When trying to invoke the action "j_spring_security_check" (which performs the authentication process) in the HTML login form, Tomcat prompts with a HTTP 404 Error "The requested document is not available"

The usage of exact the same application .war file in a Tomcat 6 and 5.5 works perfectly fine.
Researches about this issue in Google brought no results except the complains of several other developers facing the same phenomenon.

So i suspect this to be a bug within Tomcat 7, which i would like to report you in this message. 
If desired, i will provide more details on the code and configuration used to produce this error.

Best regards,

Thilo Krawietz
creator: n8wulf@web.de
markt@apache.org
text: Please provide the simplest possible test application (with source code) that demonstrates the issue.

Without a test case that demonstrates the problem, this issue will be closed as invalid on the basis (without any evidence to suggest otherwise) that the root cause is a bug in the application and/or a library it is using.

Tomcat 7 is stricter than previous versions regarding various aspects of the servlet specification and this issue may well be a manifestation of that.
creator: markt@apache.org
markt@apache.org
text:
I spoke with the Spring Security team and they are not aware of any reports of this issue. They doubled checked Spring Security 3.1.0 on Tomcat 7.0.20 and everything worked as expected.

This looks like an application issue and therefore is being resolved as invalid.
